body_html:
One thing I've been wondering about is whether we want to include deprecated stuff in the type hints.
Apparently, there isn't a canonical way to mark things as deprecated in stub files.
The main things are using Tensor(...) constructors and also deprecated functions (e.g. the docstring examples for addcmul and addcdiv use the deprecated positional arguments instead of the keyword-only ones).
body_text:
One thing I've been wondering about is whether we want to include deprecated stuff in the type hints.
Apparently, there isn't a canonical way to mark things as deprecated in stub files.
The main things are using Tensor(...) constructors and also deprecated functions (e.g. the docstring examples for addcmul and addcdiv use the deprecated positional arguments instead of the keyword-only ones).
body:
One thing I've been wondering about is whether we want to include deprecated stuff in the type hints.
Apparently, there isn't a canonical way to mark things as deprecated in stub files.
The main things are using `Tensor(...)` constructors and also deprecated functions (e.g. the docstring examples for addcmul and addcdiv use the deprecated positional arguments instead of the keyword-only ones).
